data.title: Greater Atlanta
data.meta_description: The Greater Atlanta regional headquarters serves Cherokee, Clayton, Cobb, DeKalb, Douglas, Fayette, Fulton, Gwinnett, Henry, Newton, Paulding & Rockdale counties.
data.text:
The Red Cross offers classes in: CPR, first aid, lifeguarding, learn to swim, water safety and more. Click below to learn more.

For questions about classes or certification cards you may also call: 1-800-RED-CROSS.

If you’re passionate about helping people and looking for a volunteer opportunity with a visionary humanitarian organization, you can make a difference with the American Red Cross of Atlanta. Adults and teenagers (aged 15-17) are encouraged to apply and engage in meaningful opportunities for education, training and community service.

You don’t need a special reason to give blood. You just need your own reason. Maybe you were asked by a friend or relative, or maybe you believe it's the right thing to do. Whatever your reason, the need for blood donors is constant, and your contribution is important for a healthy and reliable blood supply. You'll also feel great knowing you've helped change a life!

Your donation powers the Red Cross response to an average of more than 60,000 disasters every year nationwide, providing shelter, food, emotional support and other necessities to those affected. By making a charitable donation to the Red Cross, you are there for millions of people who face emergencies every year and help as they rebuild their lives.

Host a charity stream by playing your favorite video games while raising life-saving funds to help those in need. You can also fundraise your own way by energizing your community through celebrating a special occasion or being creative to help to those in need. Click a button below to get started!

Terri Badour is the Executive Director of the American Red Cross of Georgia, serving the Greater Atlanta chapter. During her career, she served a dual role as both the Chief Executive Officer of the American Red Cross of Georgia and the Executive Director of the Metropolitan Atlanta Chapter, as well as the Chief Development Officer for Georgia. A Michigan native, Terri holds a Bachelor of Science degree from Western Michigan University. She holds a Master of Science degree from Florida State University and completed her graduate internship with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. A graduate of Leadership Atlanta’s Class of 2001, Terri is engaged with the Rotary Club of Atlanta, Georgia Chamber of Commerce, Metro Atlanta Chamber of Commerce, and Atlanta Friendship Initiative. Terri has served on many boards, including Atlanta Children’s Shelter, Atlanta Speech School, Buckhead Christian Ministry, Healthy Mothers, Healthy Babies Coalition of Georgia, and more. She is a past president of the Junior League of Atlanta and former Chair of the Junior League’s Community Advisory Board. Terri was named to Atlanta Magazine’s Atlanta 500 Most Powerful Leaders from 2019 - 2023.

Phone: 404-805 9073

Email: Terri.Badour@redcross.org
